message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.RO, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of aligning depth scans obtained from different camera poses into the same coordinate system, which is a common problem in computer vision and robotics. The proposed approach involves using a neural network to learn the weights associated with each relative transformation, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves optimization and constraint-based approaches, which are common in the graphics (cs.GR) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories. Finally, the use of a neural network to predict weights of input relative transformations suggests that the paper may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.
